about_the_game:
Overview

Puppeteer Mode allows users to directly control their VR avatar's movements through the controllers. By holding the grip, users can manipulate their avatar's feet with precision just like a Puppet Master, enabling detailed and complex movements. When Puppeteer Mode is not active, the system continues to estimate points of your body that are not currently tracked, ensuring a continuous and seamless VR experience, even when not directly controlling the avatar. Use Puppeteer Mode when precise movements are necessary, such as during specific interactions, dances, or maneuvers depending on the situation.

Quick Video Overview of the Puppeteer Mode

Key Features

  • Puppeteer Mode: Control your feet with hand controllers like a Puppet Master.
  • Dynamic Pose Estimation: Real-time calculation of body positions and movements.
  • Low CPU Usage: Optimized for efficiency, minimizing impact on device performance.
  • No Dedicated Hardware Required: Works with existing VR headset and controllers, eliminating the need for extra devices.

Setup Guide

Here’s a streamlined setup guide for your Driver4VR Puppeteer DLC:
  • Choose 'Puppeteer' from the Body Tracking options and download the DLC. After launching Driver4VR, the Puppeteer application will automatically start. Verify that your avatar responds correctly.
  • To calibrate the floor, press the 'Calibrate Floor' button and place the controllers on the floor. Wait for the process to complete, which will be signaled by an applause sound.
  • Next, press 'Calibrate Height'.
  • Enjoy :)

Controlling Puppeteer

Use your controllers to control the feet pose:
  • Enable Puppeteer mode by holding your hands above your head and holding the grip.
  • Activate the grip to enable precise and responsive foot movement.
  • Once the grip is released, the foot will return to its estimated pose.
